newsitem.title: USA: Crop Growers Corp fined in Espy Case. [CORRECTED 01:24 GMT 22/1]
newsitem.headline: Crop Growers Corp fined in Espy Case. [CORRECTED 01:24 GMT 22/1]

text.p: (Corrects headline and first and second paragraphs to make clear companies made "no contest" plea and did not plead guilty)

The second largest crop insurance company in the nation entered a no contest plea on Tuesday to charges it funnelled illegal campaign contributions to the brother of the former Agriculture Secretary Mike Espy and agreed to pay a criminal fine of $2 million.

Crop Growers Corp of Great Falls, Montana, also entered a "no contest" plea to falsifying its books and records in the illegal scheme to help Henry Espy and gain access to his brother who was then a member of the Clinton cabinet, the office of Independent Counsel Donald Smaltz said.
The $2 million fine is the largest criminal fine ever imposed in an Indepedent Counsel matter, said an aide to Smaltz.
The former chairman of Crop Growers, John Hemmingson, was convicted last month along with New Orleans attorney Alvarez Ferrouillet of money laundering illegal compaign contributions to Henry Espy.

Former Agriculture Secretary Espy has been under special investigation by Independent Counsel Smaltz for over two years for illegally accepting gifts and favors while he was head of USDA from companies his agency was in charge of regulating.
